intro: Pelea feddei, commonly known as the Fedde's pelea, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, adapting to the harsh environmental conditions of its native habitat. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Pelea feddei is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
